The ''care pathway'' consists of organising and coordinating the right sequence of professional skills at the right time throughout a patient's care.

properties.question: What does a care pathway primarily consist of in clinical practice?
properties.option_a: A set of unrelated medical interventions applied randomly to patients.
properties.option_b: The organization and coordination of professional skills at the right time for patient care.
properties.option_c: A sequence of patient interactions with healthcare providers without a specific order.
properties.option_d: The administrative tasks and paperwork that accompany patient treatment.
